review: I've had my Apple TV for a year-and-a-half.  It works flawlessly and exactly as advertised.  The only reason I don't give it five stars is that it simply lacks a lot of native channels that any good streaming box should have, for example, Amazon, Vudu, Spotify, Rdio, TuneIn, iHeart, PlayOn, Simple.TV, BYU TV, Ebru, to name a few of the bigger ones.  A lot of these compete with Apple for customers.  As it is, I use it when I can't get something on my Roku 3 or when it offers a better user experience.  For example, I can Airplay MLB At Bat from my iOS devices during the playoffs, so I can watch games on TBS which are unavailable on MLB.TV on Roku.  I also prefer the YouTube channel on Apple TV to the one on Roku and Airplaying Spotify to an Apple TV is a better user experience than using the Roku channel.  And if you use Podcasts, Apple TV allows you to sync to your iTune's account and podcast subscriptions, which the Podcast channel on Roku does not.If you are only going to buy one streaming box, I'd go with the Roku 3, but for the money saved from cutting the cord, anyone in the iOS ecosystem can augment their streaming experience with an Apple TV for about the cost of one month's cable saved by cutting the cord.  For that use, I recommend it.
author: Gregory K. Laughlin "GL"
